posts.content:
1) PVP

2) Level cap - likely to reach 25-30, but there is no server cap

3) Race preference - halfling

4) Class preference - at least 15 barb for terrifying rage, at least 13 rogue for epic dodge

5) Melee preference - slinger preferred but can go sword and board or dual wield

6) Range preference - dex slinger

7) Weapon preference - sling (handaxe or shortsword as a secondary)
8) Maximum item enhancement - +3 base, +5 with gmw spell
9) Spellcasting - not required but if used would be just buffing or casting darkness and ultravision for sneaks in plain sight

10) Custom factors - barbs have been modded on the server that they get con and ab as opposed to con and str bonus, so can work on dex ab.


Requesting obviously dex based, eventually terrifying things to get sneaks, if needed can use darkness ultravision. something funny about a fomy mouthed hin :)

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
First off, thanks for taking the time to join our gathering.  We hope your investigations prove worthwhile, interesting and fun.  There are still enough of us around to make useful recommendations.  Welcome!  Now to the particulars...

Two points:
 
The only way to get both ED and TR by Level 30 is by sacrificing AB and feats with, perhaps, a brb15/rog14/sd1.  (ED never any earlier than Lvl 30, TR never earlier than Lvl 22).

Considering a dual-wield alternate attack is a bad idea in this build for many reasons.  First, nowhere near enough feats.  You'd need to focus in dagger as a light OH wpn for a halfling (or Kukri w/exotic). Secondly, your stealth will useless against True Seers so you'll need to run in fast and attempt an IKD and hope it lands else you will die vs. all mages and clerics, maybe even caster druids... all of which will have a far more deadly ranged attack than your sling.  Third, in order to have the best chance to KD you can do without the DW AB penalty.  Figure on very high AC counters in PvP.

Actually, a PBS slinger under a cloud of Darkness will not suffer AoOs which pretty much neutralizes any benefit of a melee switch.  Same shield gets used in either case so no AC boost.  But I've laid it all out in a sample build regardless so you can examine how many feats may be getting wasted by arranging a melee switch.  You also lose the +AB PBS bonus with a blade. 

If you care not about XP penalty, you can use Ftr instead of CoT and grab the specialization for damage but suffer the loss in saves which are pretty lame without CoT thrown into the mix.

Actually, ImpCrit for the alternate focus is not really necessary either since the attack won't be used for damage but rather for KD vs. spellcasters (and for avoiding AoOs vs. flanking mobs, if you consider PvM).

IMO, rather than using stealth I'd be investing in traps but that depends on whether the server has ample opportunities for recovering or crafting traps.  You could set traps with detection DCs too high for any class other than a rogue to spot.  But that's a whole other consideration...

Anyway, something to compare with your own ideas...

As you can see, forcing both TR and ED into such a limited build eliminates some advantages like extended crit range for both weapons and EWF for the melee switch.  AB is significantly reduced without access to Grt DEX boosts in epic.  Also, last taunt dump is too early to become a factor vs. maxed Conc foes though one detection skill could conceivably be sacrificed to reach as high as possible skill level, 26.  

The general lesson to be learned is that without many more CoT (or Ftr... w/XP penalty) levels, developing proficiency in two weapon types is impossible and the end result is a compromise between the two... not a desirable situation for PvP where the builds have been optimized to counter the weaker attack and AC.  But this is about as close to what you requested as you'll get so good luck with your plan.
